1.title: Greg Jennings/Rob Rarker
1.plot: Contributor Rob Parker joins in to react to Washington Redskins cornerback Josh Norman's criticism of professional American football free agent quarterback Colin Kaepernick; and much more. (#544)

2.title: Bryan Cox/Greg Jennings
2.plot: Shannon, Skip, guest host/moderator Jaime Maggio and National Football League analyst Greg Jennings discuss last night's Atlanta Falcons at Philadelphia Eagles game; and much more. (#545)

3.title: Weekend Edition: Best of the Week - Le'Veon vs. Steelers
3.plot: Shannon and Skip debate if the teammates of Pittsburgh Steelers running back Le'Veon Bell should be criticizing him for his holdout; and much more. (#546)

4.title: Michael Vick/Rod Woodson
4.plot: Shannon, Skip, returning host/moderator Jenny Taft and Pro Football Hall of Fame defensive back Rod Woodson discuss last night's Chicago Bears at Green Bay Packers game; and much more. (#547)

5.title: Olubowale "Wale" Akintimehin/Rob Parker/Rod Woodson
5.plot: Pro Football Hall of Fame defensive back Rod Woodson joins in to discuss last night's New York Jets at Detroit Lions game; an interview with actor, recording artist, etc. Olubowale "Wale" Akintimehin; and much more. (#548)

6.title: Joel Klatt/Rod Woodson
6.plot: Pro Football Hall of Fame defensive back Rod Woodson joins in to debate if Tom Brady of the New England Patriots believes that Aaron Rodgers of the Green Bay Packers is the better quarterback; and much more. (#549)

7.title: Mark Schlereth/Rob Parker/"On Mended Knee"
7.plot: Contributor Rob Parker joins in to preview Sunday afternoon's New England Patriots at Jacksonville Jaguars National Football League game; and much more. (#550)

8.title: Eric Dickerson/"Hype Man"
8.plot: Shannon, Skip, guest host/moderator Alex Curry and National Football League analyst Eric Dickerson preview Sunday night's New York Giants at Dallas Cowboys game; and much more. (#551)

9.title: Weekend Edition: Best of the Week - Olubowale "Wale" Akintimehin
9.plot: Shannon and Skip debate if the Dallas Cowboys are one of the worst teams in the National Football League; an interview with actor, producer and recording artist Olubowale "Wale" Akintimehin; and much more. (#552)

10.title: DeAngelo Hall/Greg Jennings

11.title: DeAngelo Hall/Rob Parker

12.title: DeAngelo Hall/Joel Klatt/Roland "Lil Duval" Powell

13.title: Greg Jennings/Rob Parker/"Take Your Pick"
13.plot: National Football League analyst Greg Jennings joins in to debate if the Dallas Cowboys need quarterback Dak Prescott to run with the football more to be successful; and much more. (#556)

1.title: Welcome to Undisputed!
1.plot: The fellas weigh in on Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo's back breaking injury; more on San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick's media firestorm; and much more.

2.title: Nate Boyer
2.plot: The guys debate if Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo should be placed on the injured reserve list now; an interview with former National Football League long snapper and former United States Army Green Beret, Nate Boyer; and much more.

3.title: Manny Pacquiao/Ray Lewis
3.plot: Shannon and Skip debate which National Football League team will win Super Bowl 51; NFL analyst Ray Lewis joins the show to discuss several topics; an interview with politician and professional boxer, Manny Pacquiao; and much more.

4.title: Michael Lombardi/Ray Lewis
4.plot: Shannon and Skip debate how impressive the Denver Broncos were in their season opening victory versus the Carolina Panthers; NFL insider Michael Lombardi and NFL analyst Ray Lewis join the show to discuss several topics; and much more.

5.title: Plaxico Burress
5.plot: Shannon and Skip discuss the Dallas Cowboys opening game loss and all of the other key moments from this past weekend's National Football League action; former NFL wide receiver Plaxico Burress joins the discussion; and much more.

6.title: Dwayne "Lil Wayne" Carter, Jr./Eric Mangini
6.plot: Shannon and Skip debate if it is time for the Los Angeles Rams to play rookie quarterback Jared Goff; an interview with hip hop recording artist Dwayne "Lil Wayne" Carter, Jr.; and much more.

7.title: Joel Klatt
7.plot: Shannon and Skip discuss Dallas Cowboys owner and general manger Jerry Jones' comments on the national anthem of the United States of America protests; college football analyst Joel Klatt joins the show; and much more.

8.title: Matt Leinart
8.plot: Shannon and Skip debate if comments made by Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott about wide receiver Dez Bryant were out-of-bounds; college football analyst Matt Leinart joins the show; and much more.

9.title: Greg Jennings/Jim Fassel
9.plot: Shannon and Skip debate the latest news in the National Football League; former NFL head coach Jim Fassel and former NFL wide receiver Greg Jennings are featured guests; and much more.

10.title: You Like Dak?!
10.plot: Shannon and Skip discuss Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott's first regular season victory and the top stories from yesterday's National Football League action and former NFL General Manager Michael Lombardi weighs in as well.

11.title: Nick Wright
11.plot: Shannon and Skip debate which rookie quarterback had the better first two games: Carson Wentz of the Philadelphia Eagles or Dak Prescott of the Dallas Cowboys; sports radio host Nick Wright joins the conversation; and much more.

12.title: Doug Baldwin/Michael Lombardi
12.plot: Joy, Shannon and Skip are joined by Seattle Seahawks wide receiver Doug Baldwin and former National Football League general manager Michael Lombardi to discuss the latest news in the world of sports; and much more.

13.title: Ray Lewis
13.plot: Shannon and Skip discuss comments by Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton about the state of unrest in North Carolina U.S.A.; National Football League analyst Ray Lewis joins in to talk about topics from around the league; and more.

14.title: Charles Tillman
14.plot: Shannon and Skip respond to Seattle Mariners baseball catcher Steve Clevenger's tweets; an interview with former National Football League cornerback Charles "Peanut" Tillman; and much more.

15.title: Remembering Arnold Palmer and Jose Fernandez
15.plot: Joy, Shannon and Skip share their thoughts on the passing of American golf legend Arnold Palmer and Miami Marlins pitcher Jose Fernandez; they debate if it was fair for Louisiana State University to fire football coach Les Miles; and more.

16.title: Saints Slow Start
16.plot: Shannon and Skip debate who is most responsible for the New Orleans Saints struggles; is it fair to compare Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Carson Wentz to retired quarterback Peyton Manning; and much more.

17.title: The Chosen One Turns Into the Frozen One: LeBron James vs. Michael Jordan
17.plot: Shannon and Skip debate why Cleveland Cavaliers forward LeBron James keeps comparing himself to professional basketball Hall of Fame legend Michael Jordan; and much more.

18.title: Rob Parker
18.plot: Shannon and Skip debate how concerned the Dallas Cowboys should be with the latest injury to wide receiver Dez Bryant; American sports anchor Rob Parker joins in to talk about San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick; and much more.

19.title: Listen to Each Other
19.plot: The guys debate who will be the winners in this Sunday's National Football League match-ups; reaction to President of the United States of America Barack Obama's comments about national anthem protests; and much more.

20.title: Michael Lombardi/"Action Jackson"
20.plot: Joy, Shannon and Skip are joined by former general manager Michael Lombardi to discuss yesterday's action in the National Football League; a discussion about University of Louisville Cardinals quarterback Lamar Jackson; and much more.

21.title: All Against Me
21.plot: The guys debate how much of the blame should be given to New York Giants wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. for the teams loss to the Minnesota Vikings on Monday Night Football; and much more.

22.title: John Lynch
22.plot: Shannon and Skip debate what the National Football League should do about the Dallas, Texas U.S.A. police department conclusion on the Denver Broncos cornerback Aqib Talib shooting; NFL analyst John Lynch joins the show; and much more.

23.title: Barry Switzer
23.plot: The guys react to Seattle Seahawks wide receiver Doug Baldwin's comments on national anthem of the United States of America protests; an interview with former American football player and coach Barry Switzer; and much more.

24.title: Michael Lombardi/"Texas-Sized Tussle"
24.plot: The guys make their picks for this Sunday's National Football League match-ups; former New England Patriots executive Michael Lombardi joins in to discuss Tom Brady's return from suspension; and much more.

25.title: There Can Only Be One: Dak Presott vs. Tony Romo
25.plot: The guys debate what the Dallas Cowboys will do when quarterback Tony Romo is healthy; New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady returns to lead the team to victory, but did he disappoint; and much more.

26.title: Protest Fallout
26.plot: Guest host Jenny Taft, Shannon and Skip tackle the subject of comments made by Ruth Bader Ginsburg on national anthem of the United States of America protests; and much more.

27.title: Eric Mangini/Joel Klatt
27.plot: Guest host Jenny Taft, Shannon and Skip discuss the latest news in the National Football League and College Football with analysts Eric Mangini and Joel Klatt; is this the Chicago Cubs year; and much more.

28.title: Rob Parker/"Dez Responds"
28.plot: The crew discuss tweets from Dallas Cowboys wide receiver Dez Bryant to Skip Bayless; sports anchor Rob Parker joins the show to debate if the New England Patriots should be the favorites to win Super Bowl 51; and much more.

29.title: Antoine Fuqua/Rob Parker
29.plot: Shannon, Skip and sports anchor Rob Parker make their picks for Sunday's National Football League games; they discuss the Thursday Night Football result; an interview with American film director and producer Antoine Fuqua; and much more.

30.title: Greg Jennings/Michael Lombardi
30.plot: Joy, Shannon and Skip are joined by former National Football League general manager Michael Lombardi and former wide receiver Greg Jennings to discuss yesterday's gridiron action.

31.title: Michael Lombardi/"Cowboys Conundrum"
31.plot: Shannon and Skip discuss the Monday Night Football result; former National Football League general manager Michael Lombardi joins in to discuss if the Dallas Cowboys should trade quarterback Tony Romo; and much more.

32.title: King's Reign

292.plot: Shannon, Skip, guest host/moderator Alex Curry and 2-time National Football League Super Bowl Champion linebacker James Harrison debate if the Philadelphia Eagles will suffer a Super Bowl hangover; and much more. (#537)

294.title: Rob Parker/Rob Ryan/"Kaepernick's Case"
294.plot: 2-time National Football League Super Bowl Champion linebackers coach Rob Ryan joins in to debate if New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski is overrated; and much more. (#539)

295.title: Weekend Edition: Best of the Week - David "Sinbad" Adkins/James Harrison
295.plot: Alex, Shannon and Skip interview actor/comedian David "Sinbad" Adkins; and much more. (#540)

297.plot: College football analyst Joel Klatt joins in to debate if University of Alabama Crimson Tide head football coach Nick Saban is handling the team's quarterback situation correctly; and much more. (#542)

298.plot: National Football League analyst Eric Dickerson joins in to debate if the Los Angeles Rams are the team to beat in the National Football Conference; and much more. (#543)
